trans-unit.source: Consume a Machine Learning web service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Consume a Machine Learning web service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Once a machine learning service is published, the RESTFul web service that is made available can be consumed either as request-response service or as a batch execution service.
trans-unit.target: Once a machine learning service is published, the RESTFul web service that is made available can be consumed either as request-response service or as a batch execution service.

trans-unit.source: When published as a web service, Azure Machine Learning experiments provide a REST API that can be consumed by a wide range of devices and platforms.
trans-unit.target: When published as a web service, Azure Machine Learning experiments provide a REST API that can be consumed by a wide range of devices and platforms.

trans-unit.source: This is because the simple REST API accepts and responds with JSON formatted messages.
trans-unit.target: This is because the simple REST API accepts and responds with JSON formatted messages.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Machine Learning portal provides code that can be used to call the web service in R, C#, and Python.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Machine Learning portal provides code that can be used to call the web service in R, C#, and Python.

trans-unit.source: But these services can be called with any programming language and from any device that satisfies three criteria:
trans-unit.target: But these services can be called with any programming language and from any device that satisfies three criteria:

trans-unit.source: Has a network connection
trans-unit.target: Has a network connection

trans-unit.source: Has SSL capabilities to perform HTTPS requests
trans-unit.target: Has SSL capabilities to perform HTTPS requests

trans-unit.source: Has the ability to parse JSON (by hand or support libraries)
trans-unit.target: Has the ability to parse JSON (by hand or support libraries)

trans-unit.source: This means the services can be consumed from web applications, mobile applications, custom desktop applications and even from within Excel.
trans-unit.target: This means the services can be consumed from web applications, mobile applications, custom desktop applications and even from within Excel.

trans-unit.source: An Azure Machine Learning web service can be consumed in two different ways, either as a request-response service or as a batch execution service.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Machine Learning web service can be consumed in two different ways, either as a request-response service or as a batch execution service.

trans-unit.source: In each scenario the functionality is provided through the RESTFul web service that is made available for consumption once the experiment has been published.
trans-unit.target: In each scenario the functionality is provided through the RESTFul web service that is made available for consumption once the experiment has been published.

trans-unit.source: Deploying a Machine Learning web service in Azure with an Azure web service end-point, where the service is automatically scaled based on usage, you can avoid upfront and ongoing costs for hardware resources.
trans-unit.target: Deploying a Machine Learning web service in Azure with an Azure web service end-point, where the service is automatically scaled based on usage, you can avoid upfront and ongoing costs for hardware resources.

trans-unit.source: For information about how to create and publish an Azure Machine Learning web service, see <linkText>Publish an Azure Machine Learning web service[publish]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about how to create and publish an Azure Machine Learning web service, see <linkText>Publish an Azure Machine Learning web service[publish]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For a step-by-step walkthrough of creating a Machine Learning experiment and publishing it, see <linkText>Develop a predictive solution by using Azure Machine Learning[walkthrough]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a step-by-step walkthrough of creating a Machine Learning experiment and publishing it, see <linkText>Develop a predictive solution by using Azure Machine Learning[walkthrough]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A Request-Response Service (RRS) is a low-latency, highly scalable web service used to provide an interface to the stateless models that have been created and published from an Azure Machine Learning Studio experiment.
trans-unit.target: A Request-Response Service (RRS) is a low-latency, highly scalable web service used to provide an interface to the stateless models that have been created and published from an Azure Machine Learning Studio experiment.

trans-unit.source: RRS accepts a single row of input parameters and generates a single row as output.
trans-unit.target: RRS accepts a single row of input parameters and generates a single row as output.

trans-unit.source: The output row can contain multiple columns.
trans-unit.target: The output row can contain multiple columns.

trans-unit.source: An example for RRS is validating the authenticity of an application.
trans-unit.target: An example for RRS is validating the authenticity of an application.

trans-unit.source: Hundreds to millions of installations of an application can be expected in this case.
trans-unit.target: Hundreds to millions of installations of an application can be expected in this case.

trans-unit.source: When the application starts up, it makes a call to the RRS service with the relevant input.
trans-unit.target: When the application starts up, it makes a call to the RRS service with the relevant input.

trans-unit.source: The application then receives a validation response from the service that either allows or blocks the application from performing.
trans-unit.target: The application then receives a validation response from the service that either allows or blocks the application from performing.

trans-unit.source: A Batch Execution Service (BES) is a service that handles high volume, asynchronous, scoring of a batch of data records.
trans-unit.target: A Batch Execution Service (BES) is a service that handles high volume, asynchronous, scoring of a batch of data records.

trans-unit.source: The input for the BES contains a batch of records from a variety of sources, such as blobs, tables in Azure, SQL Azure, HDInsight (results of a Hive Query, for example), and HTTP sources.
trans-unit.target: The input for the BES contains a batch of records from a variety of sources, such as blobs, tables in Azure, SQL Azure, HDInsight (results of a Hive Query, for example), and HTTP sources.

trans-unit.source: The output for the BES contains the results of the scoring.
trans-unit.target: The output for the BES contains the results of the scoring.

trans-unit.source: Results are output to a file in Azure blob storage and data from the storage endpoint is returned in the response.
trans-unit.target: Results are output to a file in Azure blob storage and data from the storage endpoint is returned in the response.

trans-unit.source: A BES would be useful when responses are not needed immediately, such as for regularly scheduled scoring for individuals or internet of things (IOT) devices.
trans-unit.target: A BES would be useful when responses are not needed immediately, such as for regularly scheduled scoring for individuals or internet of things (IOT) devices.

trans-unit.source: To show how both RRS and BES work, we use an example Azure Web Service.
trans-unit.target: To show how both RRS and BES work, we use an example Azure Web Service.

trans-unit.source: This service would be used in an IOT (Internet Of Things) scenario.
trans-unit.target: This service would be used in an IOT (Internet Of Things) scenario.

trans-unit.source: To keep it simple, our device only sends up one value, cog_speed, and gets a single answer back.
trans-unit.target: To keep it simple, our device only sends up one value, cog_speed, and gets a single answer back.

trans-unit.source: There are four pieces of information that are needed to call either the RRS or BES service.
trans-unit.target: There are four pieces of information that are needed to call either the RRS or BES service.

trans-unit.source: This information is readily available from the service pages in <linkText>Azure Machine Learning service pages</linkText><title></title> once the experiment has been published.
trans-unit.target: This information is readily available from the service pages in <linkText>Azure Machine Learning service pages</linkText><title></title> once the experiment has been published.

trans-unit.source: Click on the WEB SERVICES link at the left of the screen and you will see the published services.
trans-unit.target: Click on the WEB SERVICES link at the left of the screen and you will see the published services.

trans-unit.source: To find information about a specific service, there are API help page links for both RRS and BES.
trans-unit.target: To find information about a specific service, there are API help page links for both RRS and BES.

trans-unit.source: The service API Key, available on the services main page
trans-unit.target: The service API Key, available on the services main page

trans-unit.source: The service URI, available on the API help page for the chosen service
trans-unit.target: The service URI, available on the API help page for the chosen service

trans-unit.source: The expected API request body, available on the API help page for the chosen service
trans-unit.target: The expected API request body, available on the API help page for the chosen service

trans-unit.source: The expected API response body, available on the API help page for the chosen service
trans-unit.target: The expected API response body, available on the API help page for the chosen service

trans-unit.source: In the two examples below, the C# language is used to illustrate the code needed and the targeted platform is a Windows 8 desktop.
trans-unit.target: In the two examples below, the C# language is used to illustrate the code needed and the targeted platform is a Windows 8 desktop.

trans-unit.source: On the API help page, aside from the URI, you will input and output definitions and code samples.
trans-unit.target: On the API help page, aside from the URI, you will input and output definitions and code samples.

trans-unit.source: The API input is called out, for this service specifically, and is the payload of the API call.
trans-unit.target: The API input is called out, for this service specifically, and is the payload of the API call.

trans-unit.source: Sample Request
trans-unit.target: Sample Request

trans-unit.source: Similarly, the API response is also called out, again for this service specifically.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, the API response is also called out, again for this service specifically.

trans-unit.source: Sample Response
trans-unit.target: Sample Response

trans-unit.source: Towards the bottom of the page you will find the code examples.
trans-unit.target: Towards the bottom of the page you will find the code examples.

trans-unit.source: Below is the code sample for the C# implementation
trans-unit.target: Below is the code sample for the C# implementation

trans-unit.source: Sample Code
trans-unit.target: Sample Code

trans-unit.source: On the API help page, in addition to the URI, you will find information about several calls that are available.
trans-unit.target: On the API help page, in addition to the URI, you will find information about several calls that are available.

trans-unit.source: Unlike the RRS service, the BES service is asynchronous.
trans-unit.target: Unlike the RRS service, the BES service is asynchronous.

trans-unit.source: This means that the BES API is simply queuing up a job to be executed, and the caller polls the job's status to see when it has completed.
trans-unit.target: This means that the BES API is simply queuing up a job to be executed, and the caller polls the job's status to see when it has completed.

trans-unit.source: Here are the operations currently supported for batch jobs:
trans-unit.target: Here are the operations currently supported for batch jobs:

trans-unit.source: Create (submit) a batch job
trans-unit.target: Create (submit) a batch job

trans-unit.source: Start this batch job
trans-unit.target: Start this batch job

trans-unit.source: Get the status or result of the batch job
trans-unit.target: Get the status or result of the batch job

trans-unit.source: Cancel a running batch job
trans-unit.target: Cancel a running batch job

trans-unit.source: Create a Batch Execution Job**
trans-unit.target: Create a Batch Execution Job**

trans-unit.source: When creating a batch job for your Azure Machine Learning service endpoint, one can specify several parameters that will define this batch execution:
trans-unit.target: When creating a batch job for your Azure Machine Learning service endpoint, one can specify several parameters that will define this batch execution:

trans-unit.source: Input: represents a blob reference to where the batch job's input is stored.
trans-unit.target: Input: represents a blob reference to where the batch job's input is stored.

trans-unit.source: GlobalParameters: represents the set of global parameters one can define for their experiment.
trans-unit.target: GlobalParameters: represents the set of global parameters one can define for their experiment.

trans-unit.source: An Azure Machine Learning experiment can have both required and optional parameters that customize the service's execution, and the caller is expected to provide all required parameters, if applicable.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Machine Learning experiment can have both required and optional parameters that customize the service's execution, and the caller is expected to provide all required parameters, if applicable.

trans-unit.source: These parameters are specified as a collection of key-value pairs.
trans-unit.target: These parameters are specified as a collection of key-value pairs.

trans-unit.source: Outputs: if the service has defined one or more outputs, we allow the caller to redirect any of them to an Azure blob location of their choice.
trans-unit.target: Outputs: if the service has defined one or more outputs, we allow the caller to redirect any of them to an Azure blob location of their choice.

trans-unit.source: This will allow you to save the service's output(s) in a preferred location and under a predictable name, as otherwise the output blob name is randomly generated.
trans-unit.target: This will allow you to save the service's output(s) in a preferred location and under a predictable name, as otherwise the output blob name is randomly generated.

trans-unit.source: NOTE that the service expects the output content, based on its type, to be saved as supported formats:
trans-unit.target: NOTE that the service expects the output content, based on its type, to be saved as supported formats:

trans-unit.source: data set outputs: can save as .csv, .tsv, .arff
trans-unit.target: data set outputs: can save as .csv, .tsv, .arff

trans-unit.source: trained model outputs: can save as .ilearner
trans-unit.target: trained model outputs: can save as .ilearner

trans-unit.source: Output location overrides are specified as a collection of pairs, where the output name is the user defined name for a specific output node (also shown on the service's API help page), and blob reference is a reference to an Azure blob location where the output is to be redirected to.
trans-unit.target: Output location overrides are specified as a collection of pairs, where the output name is the user defined name for a specific output node (also shown on the service's API help page), and blob reference is a reference to an Azure blob location where the output is to be redirected to.

trans-unit.source: All these job creation parameters can be optional depending on the nature of your service.
trans-unit.target: All these job creation parameters can be optional depending on the nature of your service.

trans-unit.source: For example, services with no input node defined, do not require passing in an Input parameter, and the output location override feature is completely optional, as outputs will otherwise be stored in the default storage account that was set up for your Azure Machine Learning workspace.
trans-unit.target: For example, services with no input node defined, do not require passing in an Input parameter, and the output location override feature is completely optional, as outputs will otherwise be stored in the default storage account that was set up for your Azure Machine Learning workspace.

trans-unit.source: Below, we show a sample request payload, as passed to the REST API, for a service where only the input information is passed in:
trans-unit.target: Below, we show a sample request payload, as passed to the REST API, for a service where only the input information is passed in:

trans-unit.source: Sample Request
trans-unit.target: Sample Request

trans-unit.source: The response to the batch job creation API is the unique job id that was associated to your job.
trans-unit.target: The response to the batch job creation API is the unique job id that was associated to your job.

trans-unit.source: This id is very important because it provides the only means for you to reference this job in the system for other operations.
trans-unit.target: This id is very important because it provides the only means for you to reference this job in the system for other operations.

trans-unit.source: Sample Response
trans-unit.target: Sample Response

trans-unit.source: Start a Batch Execution Job**
trans-unit.target: Start a Batch Execution Job**

trans-unit.source: Creating a batch job only registers it within the system, and places it in a Not started state.
trans-unit.target: Creating a batch job only registers it within the system, and places it in a Not started state.

trans-unit.source: To actually schedule the job for execution, you will have to call the start API described on the service endpoint's API help page and provide the job id obtained when the job was created.
trans-unit.target: To actually schedule the job for execution, you will have to call the start API described on the service endpoint's API help page and provide the job id obtained when the job was created.

trans-unit.source: Get the Status of a Batch Execution Job**
trans-unit.target: Get the Status of a Batch Execution Job**

trans-unit.source: You can poll the status of your asynchronous batch job at any time by passing the job's id to the GetJobStatus API.
trans-unit.target: You can poll the status of your asynchronous batch job at any time by passing the job's id to the GetJobStatus API.

trans-unit.source: The API response will contain an indicator of the job's current state, as well as the actual results of the batch job if this has completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: The API response will contain an indicator of the job's current state, as well as the actual results of the batch job if this has completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: In the case of an error, more information about the actual reasons behind the failure are returned in the Details property.
trans-unit.target: In the case of an error, more information about the actual reasons behind the failure are returned in the Details property.

trans-unit.source: Response Payload
trans-unit.target: Response Payload

trans-unit.source: StatusCode can be one of the following:
trans-unit.target: StatusCode can be one of the following:

trans-unit.source: Not started
trans-unit.target: Not started

trans-unit.source: Running
trans-unit.target: Running

trans-unit.source: Failed
trans-unit.target: Failed

trans-unit.source: Cancelled
trans-unit.target: Cancelled

trans-unit.source: Finished
trans-unit.target: Finished

trans-unit.source: The Results property is populated only if the job has completed successfully (it is null otherwise).
trans-unit.target: The Results property is populated only if the job has completed successfully (it is null otherwise).

trans-unit.source: Upon the job's completion and if the service has at least one output node defined, the results will be returned as a collection of [output name, blob reference] pairs, where the blob reference is a SAS read-only reference to the blob containing the actual result.
trans-unit.target: Upon the job's completion and if the service has at least one output node defined, the results will be returned as a collection of [output name, blob reference] pairs, where the blob reference is a SAS read-only reference to the blob containing the actual result.

trans-unit.source: Sample Response
trans-unit.target: Sample Response

trans-unit.source: Cancel a Batch Execution Job**
trans-unit.target: Cancel a Batch Execution Job**

trans-unit.source: A running batch job can be cancelled at any time by calling the designated CancelJob API and passing in the job's id.
trans-unit.target: A running batch job can be cancelled at any time by calling the designated CancelJob API and passing in the job's id.

trans-unit.source: This would be done for various reasons such as that the job is taking too long to complete.
trans-unit.target: This would be done for various reasons such as that the job is taking too long to complete.

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>BES SDK Nugget package</linkText><title></title> provides functions that simplify calling BES to score in batch mode.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>BES SDK Nugget package</linkText><title></title> provides functions that simplify calling BES to score in batch mode.

trans-unit.source: To install the Nuget package, in Visual Studio, go to Tools, then select Nuget Package Manager, and click Package Manager Console.
trans-unit.target: To install the Nuget package, in Visual Studio, go to Tools, then select Nuget Package Manager, and click Package Manager Console.

trans-unit.source: AzureML experiments that are published as web services can include web service input modules which means they expect the input to be provided through the web service call in the form of a reference to a blob location.
trans-unit.target: AzureML experiments that are published as web services can include web service input modules which means they expect the input to be provided through the web service call in the form of a reference to a blob location.

trans-unit.source: There is also the option of not using a web service input module and using a Reader module instead.
trans-unit.target: There is also the option of not using a web service input module and using a Reader module instead.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the Reader typically would read from a SQL DB using a query at run time to get the data.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the Reader typically would read from a SQL DB using a query at run time to get the data.

trans-unit.source: Web service parameters can be used to dynamically point to other servers or tables, etc. The SDK supports both of these patterns.
trans-unit.target: Web service parameters can be used to dynamically point to other servers or tables, etc. The SDK supports both of these patterns.

trans-unit.source: The code sample below demonstrates how you can submit and monitor a batch job against an Azure Machine Learning service endpoint using the BES SDK.
trans-unit.target: The code sample below demonstrates how you can submit and monitor a batch job against an Azure Machine Learning service endpoint using the BES SDK.

trans-unit.target: Note the comments for details on the settings and calls.
